<!-- This is a WordPress eXtended RSS file generated by WordPress as an export of your blog. -->
<!-- It contains information about your blog's posts, comments, and categories. -->
<!-- You may use this file to transfer that content from one site to another. -->
<!-- This file is not intended to serve as a complete backup of your blog. -->

<!-- To import this information into a WordPress blog follow these steps. -->
<!-- 1. Log in to that blog as an administrator. -->
<!-- 2. Go to Tools: Import in the blog's admin panels (or Manage: Import in older versions of WordPress). -->
<!-- 3. Choose "WordPress" from the list. -->
<!-- 4. Upload this file using the form provided on that page. -->
<!-- 5. You will first be asked to map the authors in this export file to users -->
<!--    on the blog.  For each author, you may choose to map to an -->
<!--    existing user on the blog or to create a new user -->
<!-- 6. WordPress will then import each of the posts, comments, and categories -->
<!--    contained in this file into your blog -->

<!-- generator="WordPress.com" created="2011-02-10 16:11"-->

		<dc:creator><![CDATA[estudandoemdublin]]></dc:creator>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="dublin"><![CDATA[dublin]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[english]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="english"><![CDATA[english]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[ireland]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="ireland"><![CDATA[ireland]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Uncategorized]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="uncategorized"><![CDATA[Uncategorized]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://estudandoemdublin.wordpress.com/?p=5</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<a href="http://estudandoemdublin.files.wordpress.com/2011/01/snow.jpg"><img class="alignleft size-medium wp-image-6" title="snow" src="http://estudandoemdublin.files.wordpress.com/2011/01/snow.jpg?w=168" alt="" width="168" height="300" /></a>Fala, pessoal. Tudo certo? Meu nome é Rogério Brandão, tenho 24 anos e estou morando em Dublin desde setembro do ano passado. Usarei este espaço para contar um pouco mais sobre como é <a title="Learn English Dublin" href="http://www.ulearn.ie/learn_english_dublin" target="_blank">Aprender Inglês Dublin</a> e também sobre a minha vivência no exterior.

Além de querer melhorar a língua, decidi vir para a Irlanda para entrar em contato com culturas diferentes e também para conseguir melhores empregos quando voltar ao Brasil. Minhas aulas começaram no início de outubro e têm sido essenciais para melhorar a fluência na língua tanto escrita quanto falada.

Em quase quatro meses, o temido sotaque irlandês deixou de ser tão complicado, apesar de eu ainda ter dificuldade em entender alguns nativos que têm inglês menos amigável aos meus ouvidos.

Para você ter uma ideia de como são as minhas <a title="English Classes Dublin" href="http://www.ulearn.ie/quality_english_courses_dublin" target="_blank">Aulas de Inglês Dublin</a>, vou falar sobre o conteúdo que tenho aprendido com o professor. Meu cotidiano na Ilha Esmeralda e dicas em geral também farão parte do cardápio deste blog.

Como estudante, também arriscarei postar em inglês para manter a prática e ao mesmo tempo compartilhar minhas experiências.

Sejam bem-vindos e sintam-se à vontade de tirar dúvidas!]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

		<item>
		<title>Far from Brazil to Learn English Dublin</title>
		<link>http://estudandoemdublin.wordpress.com/2011/01/28/far-from-brazil-to-learn-english-dublin/</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 28 Jan 2011 17:44:23 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[estudandoemdublin]]></dc:creator>
		
		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[dublin]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="dublin"><![CDATA[dublin]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[english]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="english"><![CDATA[english]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[ireland]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="ireland"><![CDATA[ireland]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Uncategorized]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="uncategorized"><![CDATA[Uncategorized]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://estudandoemdublin.wordpress.com/?p=10</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<a href="http://estudandoemdublin.files.wordpress.com/2011/01/pub.jpg"><img class="alignright size-medium wp-image-11" title="pub" src="http://estudandoemdublin.files.wordpress.com/2011/01/pub.jpg?w=300" alt="" width="300" height="225" /></a>Hi there. My name is Rogério Brandão, I’m 24 years old and I’ve been living in Dublin since september last year. I’ll be using this space to write for those who want to <a title="Learn English Dublin" href="http://www.ulearn.ie/learn_english_dublin" target="_blank">Learn English Dublin</a> and also want to know about my experiences now that I’m living abroad.

Apart from improving the language, I decided to come to Ireland to get in touch with different cultures and also to look for better job positions when I go back to Brazil. My classes started early october and it has been essential to enhance my language skills.

In almost four months, the challenging irish accent is not as complicated as before even though I still can’t fully comprehend some natives who speak too quick and not clear to my ears.

My intention is to blog about some contents I’ve been learning at my <a title="English Classes Dublin" href="http://www.ulearn.ie/quality_english_courses_dublin" target="_blank">English Classes Dublin</a>. My routine here at the Emerald Island and some general tips will also be included here.

Welcome and feel free to ask some questions!]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

		<item>
		<title>Minhas Aulas de Inglês em Dublin</title>
		<link>http://estudandoemdublin.wordpress.com/2011/01/28/minhas-aulas-de-ingles-em-dublin/</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 28 Jan 2011 17:45:04 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[estudandoemdublin]]></dc:creator>
		
		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[classes]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="classes"><![CDATA[classes]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[dublin]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="dublin"><![CDATA[dublin]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[english]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="english"><![CDATA[english]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[ireland]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="ireland"><![CDATA[ireland]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[school]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="school"><![CDATA[school]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Uncategorized]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="uncategorized"><![CDATA[Uncategorized]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://estudandoemdublin.wordpress.com/?p=13</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<a href="http://estudandoemdublin.files.wordpress.com/2011/01/school.jpg"><img class="aligncenter size-full wp-image-14" title="school" src="http://estudandoemdublin.files.wordpress.com/2011/01/school.jpg" alt="" width="640" height="480" /></a>Quando planejamos morar no exterior para melhorar o inglês, uma das decisões mais importantes é escolher a escola ideal. Como Dublin oferece várias opções, é comum mudarmos de ideia várias vezes até chegarmos a uma conclusão.

Depois de pensar em estudar em quatro escolas, finalmente escolhi uma <a title="English School Dublin" href="http://www.ulearn.ie/english_school_dublin" target="_blank">Escola de Inglês em Dublin</a> que correspondia às minhas expectativas. Logo no primeiro dia de aula, fui classificado direto para o nível avançado. À princípio, fiquei com um certo receio de não acompanhar o ritmo da classe. Porém, após alguns dias notei que estava no nível ideal e passei a me sentir mais à vontade para fazer perguntas e opinar sobre alguns assuntos.

A temática das aulas muda a cada semana e pode abranger de economia a emoções ou comportamento. Aprendemos vocabulário relacionado ao assunto assim como gramática e expressões. Às quintas, dois alunos realizam uma apresentação oral sobre o tema da semana e a prova é sempre às sextas. Neste teste, temos que criar frases usando o vocabulário da semana, corrigir frases com erros gramaticais e também escrever uma redação.

Esta foi uma breve descrição sobre minhas aulas que servem como uma introdução sobre mais assuntos relacionados ao meu <a title="English Course Dublin" href="http://www.ulearn.ie/english_courses_dublin" target="_blank">Curso de Inglês em Dublin</a>.]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>13</wp:post_id>

		<wp:comment_status>open</wp:comment_status>

							</item>
		<item>
		<title>My English Classes Dublin</title>
		<link>http://estudandoemdublin.wordpress.com/2011/01/28/my-english-classes-dublin/</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 28 Jan 2011 17:45:32 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[estudandoemdublin]]></dc:creator>
		
		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[classes]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="classes"><![CDATA[classes]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[dublin]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="dublin"><![CDATA[dublin]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[english]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="english"><![CDATA[english]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[ireland]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="ireland"><![CDATA[ireland]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[school]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="school"><![CDATA[school]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Uncategorized]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="uncategorized"><![CDATA[Uncategorized]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://estudandoemdublin.wordpress.com/?p=17</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<a href="http://estudandoemdublin.files.wordpress.com/2011/01/schoolparty1.jpg"><img class="alignright size-medium wp-image-19" title="schoolparty" src="http://estudandoemdublin.files.wordpress.com/2011/01/schoolparty1.jpg?w=300" alt="" width="300" height="225" /></a>When we set a plan to live abroad in order to improve the english, one of the most important decisions we have to make is to choose the school we want to study. As we have many options here in Dublin, it’s natural to change our minds from day to night.

After considering studying in four schools, I finally opted for an <a title="English School Dublin" href="http://www.ulearn.ie/english_school_dublin" target="_blank">English School Dublin</a> which suited my needs. I was sent straight away to the advanced level right at my first day of class. In the beginning it made me a bit nervous as I thought I wouldn’t follow the pace of my classmates and teacher. However, after some days I noticed that I was at a level which suited me and felt more comfortable to ask more questions and discuss about some subjects.

Every week there is a different topic of discussion and it varies from economy to emotions or behaviour. We learn the vocabulary related to the subject as well as grammar and expressions. On thursdays, two students have to give an oral presentation about the topic of the week and the progress test is always on fridays. In this exam we have to create sentences using the vocabulary of the week, correct mistakes and also write an essay.

This was a brief description about my classes that serves as an introduction about more aspects related to my <a title="English Language School" href="http://www.ulearn.ie/english_courses_ulearn" target="_blank">English Language School</a>.]]></content:encoded>

							</item>
		<item>
		<title>Classmates na minha escola de inglês em Dublin</title>
		<link>http://estudandoemdublin.wordpress.com/2011/02/02/classmates-na-minha-escola-de-ingles-em-dublin/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 02 Feb 2011 17:28:24 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[estudandoemdublin]]></dc:creator>
		
		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[classes]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="classes"><![CDATA[classes]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[classmates]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="classmates"><![CDATA[classmates]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[dublin]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="dublin"><![CDATA[dublin]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[english]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="english"><![CDATA[english]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[ireland]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="ireland"><![CDATA[ireland]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Uncategorized]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="uncategorized"><![CDATA[Uncategorized]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://estudandoemdublin.wordpress.com/?p=29</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<a href="http://estudandoemdublin.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/07.jpg"><img class="aligncenter size-full wp-image-30" title="07" src="http://estudandoemdublin.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/07.jpg" alt="" width="640" height="424" /></a>Opa, tudo certo? Hoje vou escrever sobre algo que sempre me perguntam: colegas de classe. Este é outro quesito importante na hora de decidir <a title="Learn English Dublin" href="http://www.ulearn.ie/learn_english_dublin" target="_blank">aprender inglês em Dublin</a> tendo em vista que sempre temos receio de estudar somente com brasileiros na classe.

Desde que comecei as aulas, o número máximo de estudante na sala foi 9 e o mínimo foi 3. Já tive classmates da Alemanha, Coréia do Sul, Holanda, França, Tailândia, Rússia e Somália. Atualmente, estudo com pessoas da Espanha, Sérvia, Colômbia, Malásia e México. Era isto o que eu queria, pois enquanto aprendo inglês também posso saber mais sobre a cultura de diferentes países.

No ano passado, quando tinha mais alunos, sempre tentávamos organizar encontros e a atmosfera era ótima. Infelizmente, 2011 chegou e muitos voltaram para seus países de origem ou terminaram o curso.

Agora você deve estar imaginando: "Que isso! Vai me dizer que não tinha sequer mais um brasileiro na sua classe? E eu respondo: Sim, claro. Na verdade, já estudei com mais quatro conterrâneos ao mesmo tempo e isso nunca atrapalhou as classes já que todos têm bom nível de inglês e são dedicados.

Essa foi mais uma breve história sobre a rotina durante meu <a title="English Courses Dublin" href="http://www.ulearn.ie/english_courses_dublin" target="_blank">curso de inglês em Dublin</a>.

Até a próxima.]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>29</wp:post_id>
		<wp:post_date>2011-02-02 17:28:24</wp:post_date>
		<wp:post_date_gmt>2011-02-02 17:28:24</wp:post_date_gmt>
		<wp:comment_status>open</wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status>open</wp:ping_status>
		<wp:post_name>classmates-na-minha-escola-de-ingles-em-dublin</wp:post_name>
		<wp:status>publish</wp:status>
		<wp:post_parent>0</wp:post_parent>
		<wp:menu_order>0</wp:menu_order>
		<wp:post_type>post</wp:post_type>
		<wp:post_password></wp:post_password>
		<wp:is_sticky>0</wp:is_sticky>
								<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key>_edit_last</wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[20122215]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
				<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key>_edit_lock</wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[1296667709:20122215]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
				<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key>jabber_published</wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[1296667705]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							</item>
		<item>
		<title>Classmates at my English School Dublin</title>
		<link>http://estudandoemdublin.wordpress.com/2011/02/02/classmates-at-my-english-school-dublin/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 02 Feb 2011 17:29:05 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[estudandoemdublin]]></dc:creator>
		
		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[classes]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="classes"><![CDATA[classes]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[classmates]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="classmates"><![CDATA[classmates]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[dublin]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="dublin"><![CDATA[dublin]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[english]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="english"><![CDATA[english]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[ireland]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="ireland"><![CDATA[ireland]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Uncategorized]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="uncategorized"><![CDATA[Uncategorized]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://estudandoemdublin.wordpress.com/?p=26</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<a href="http://estudandoemdublin.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/13.jpg"><img class="aligncenter size-full wp-image-27" title="13" src="http://estudandoemdublin.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/13.jpg" alt="" width="640" height="480" /></a>

Howdy! Today I'm going to write about a question I am frequently asked: classmates. This is another important aspect when we decide to <a title="Learn English Dublin" href="http://www.ulearn.ie/learn_english_dublin" target="_blank">Learn English Dublin</a> as we are always afraid of sutdying with almost 100% of brazilians at the same class.

Since I started my classes, the maximum of students in my class was 9 and the minimum was 3. I already had classmates from Germany, South Korea, Netherlands, France, Thailand, Russia, Somalia. At the moment, I have classes with people from Spain, Serbia, Colombia, Malaysia and Mexico. It's what I was looking for as I can learn about different cultures while I learn the language.

Last year, when the class had more students, we always tried to organize meetings and the atmosphere was great. Unfortunately, 2011 has arrived and many of them either returned to their own countries or finished the course.

Now you might be thinking: "C'mon, I know that there are at least one more brazilian studying with you". And I answer: Yep, there is. Actually, I had four classmates from my country at the same time and it never spoiled the class as everyone had a good level of english and was dedicated.

This was another brief story about my routine during my <a title="English Course Dublin" href="http://www.ulearn.ie/english_courses_dublin" target="_blank">English Course Dublin</a>.

See you soon.]]></content:encoded>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[ireland]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="ireland"><![CDATA[ireland]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Uncategorized]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="uncategorized"><![CDATA[Uncategorized]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://estudandoemdublin.wordpress.com/?p=54</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<a href="http://estudandoemdublin.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/dsc00734.jpg"></a><a href="http://estudandoemdublin.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/dsc00735.jpg"><img class="alignright size-medium wp-image-56" title="DSC00735" src="http://estudandoemdublin.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/dsc00735.jpg?w=300" alt="" width="300" height="168" /></a>Opa, tudo bem? Aqui estou novamente para compartilhar minhas experiências enquanto faço meu <a title="English Courses Dublin" href="http://www.ulearn.ie/english_courses_dublin" target="_blank">Curso de Inglês em Dublin</a>.

Desta vez, quero deixar de lado minhas opiniões como estudante e revelar um dos meus hobbies favoritos: ir à shows. Meus amigos mais próximos sabem quão obcecado eu sou por eventos musicais e costumava ir pelo menos uma vez por ano em algum festival em São Paulo. Aqui na Irlanda, já tive a chance de ver ótimas apresentações em casas de show de médio ou pequeno porte.

Quando estava no Brasil, tive a ajuda do meu cartão de crédito salvador para comprar os ingressos com a opção de retirá-los na bilheteria, o que foi bem conveniente tendo em vista que eu estava do outro lado do Oceano Atlântico. O primeiro show a que assisti aqui foi dos norte-americanos do Of Montreal no The Academy quatro dias após chegar em solos irlandeses. Além desta banda, também já tive a oportunidade de ver Marina and the Diamonds, Arcade Fire, Vampire Weekend, LCD Soundsystem e outros se apresentando.

<a href="http://estudandoemdublin.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/dsc00597.jpg"></a><a href="http://estudandoemdublin.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/dsc00600.jpg"><img class="alignleft size-medium wp-image-58" title="DSC00600" src="http://estudandoemdublin.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/dsc00600.jpg?w=168" alt="" width="168" height="300" /></a>A principal diferença entre os shows aqui e no Brasil é que posso chegar perto da grade sem grandes problemas e também não é comum ser espremido pelo público. Por outro lado, em Dublin não tenho meus amigos por perto e a recepção dos frequentadores à banda é mais fria.

Mesmo sendo ótimo ter tantas opções, é frustrante ver a agenda de shows e perceber que é inviável pagar para ir a todas as apresentações que quero. Imagino que valha mais a pena evitar gastar em shows avulsos e investir em um grande festival como o Oxegen ou até mesmo um evento de médio porte como o Electric Picnic.

Segue abaixo o vídeo do divertidíssimo show do Of Montreal:

[youtube=http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=bdK8ygDWJks&amp;w=640&amp;h=390]

Caso você queira ver mais vídeos que gravei, esta é a <a href="http://www.youtube.com/user/rogeriobrandao" target="_blank">minha página do youtube</a>.

Por hoje é só. Retorno na próxima semana com mais histórias sobre minha <a title="English Courses Dublin" href="http://www.ulearn.ie/english_courses_dublin" target="_blank">Curso de Inglês em Dublin</a>.]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>54</wp:post_id>
		<wp:post_date>2011-02-03 18:42:12</wp:post_date>
		<wp:post_date_gmt>2011-02-03 18:42:12</wp:post_date_gmt>
		<wp:comment_status>open</wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status>open</wp:ping_status>
		<wp:post_name>shows-ja-vistos-durante-meu-curso-de-ingles-em-dublin</wp:post_name>
		<wp:status>publish</wp:status>
		<wp:post_parent>0</wp:post_parent>
		<wp:menu_order>0</wp:menu_order>
		<wp:post_type>post</wp:post_type>

		</wp:postmeta>

		<wp:meta_key>_edit_lock</wp:meta_key>

		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[1296758534]]></wp:meta_value>

							</item>
		<item>
		<title>Watching concerts during my English Course Dublin</title>
		<link>http://estudandoemdublin.wordpress.com/2011/02/03/watching-concerts-during-my-english-course-dublin/</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 03 Feb 2011 18:42:57 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[estudandoemdublin]]></dc:creator>
		
		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[concerts]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="concerts"><![CDATA[concerts]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[dublin]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="dublin"><![CDATA[dublin]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[english]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="english"><![CDATA[english]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[gigs]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="gigs"><![CDATA[gigs]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[ireland]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="ireland"><![CDATA[ireland]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Uncategorized]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="uncategorized"><![CDATA[Uncategorized]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://estudandoemdublin.wordpress.com/?p=38</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<a href="http://estudandoemdublin.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/dsc005721.jpg"><img class="alignleft size-medium wp-image-49" title="DSC005721" src="http://estudandoemdublin.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/dsc005721.jpg?w=300" alt="" width="300" height="168" /></a>

Heya! Here I am again to share some experiences during my <a title="English Courses Dublin" href="http://www.ulearn.ie/english_courses_dublin" target="_blank">English Course Dublin</a>.

This time I want to avoid describing my routine as a student and reveal one of my favourite hobbies: going to gigs. My closest friends know how obsessed for music I am and I used to attend at least one festival per year in Brazil. Here in Ireland I already had the chance to watch a lot of great acts performing in small or medium-sized venues.

When I was in Brazil, I had the help of my magical credit card to buy the tickets with the "box office collection" option, which was pretty convenient for cases like mine. The very first gig I saw here was from the US band Of Montreal at The Academy four days after my arrival. Also, I had the opportunity to see Marina and the Diamonds, Arcade Fire, Vampire Weekend, LCD Soundsystem and others performing live.

<a href="http://estudandoemdublin.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/dsc003341.jpg"><img class="alignright size-medium wp-image-51" title="DSC003341" src="http://estudandoemdublin.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/dsc003341.jpg?w=190" alt="" width="190" height="300" /></a>The main differences between gigs here and in Brazil is that I can easily stay on the front row with no hassle and it's not usual to get squeezed by the audience, which makes the experience much more comfortable. On the other hand, in Dublin I don't have my close friends by my side and gig-goers are less warm.

Even though it's nice to have so many options, it's frustrating to see gig listings and realize that I can't afford all the events I want to attend. I suppose that saving money for a big festival like Oxegen or even for the medium-sized Electric Picnic is more practical and less expensive than single concerts.

Here's a video I shot from the outstanding Arcade Fire playing at The O2:

[youtube=http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=U5ZViYUG7Tk&amp;w=640&amp;h=390]

If you want to find other videos I shot, here's my <a href="http://www.youtube.com/user/rogeriobrandao" target="_blank">youtube profile page</a>.

Next week I come back with more stories of my <a title="English Courses Dublin" href="http://www.ulearn.ie/english_courses_dublin" target="_blank">English Course Dublin</a>.]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

		<item>
		<title>Passeios culturais da minha escola de inglês</title>
		<link>http://estudandoemdublin.wordpress.com/2011/02/09/passeios-culturais-da-minha-escola-de-ingles/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 09 Feb 2011 19:03:10 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[estudandoemdublin]]></dc:creator>
		
		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[dublin]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="dublin"><![CDATA[dublin]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[english]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="english"><![CDATA[english]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[galleries]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="galleries"><![CDATA[galleries]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[ireland]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="ireland"><![CDATA[ireland]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[museums]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="museums"><![CDATA[museums]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Uncategorized]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="uncategorized"><![CDATA[Uncategorized]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://estudandoemdublin.wordpress.com/?p=69</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<a href="http://estudandoemdublin.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/hughlane.jpg"><img class="alignleft size-medium wp-image-70" title="hughlane" src="http://estudandoemdublin.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/hughlane.jpg?w=300" alt="" width="300" height="225" /></a>Para quem ainda pensa que inglês só se aprende em sala de aula, saiba que durante o dia-a-dia várias situações podem te ajudar a incrementar o vocabulário, a gramática, o speaking e o listening. Por isso, <a title="Learn English Dublin" href="http://www.ulearn.ie/learn_english_dublin" target="_blank">Aprender Inglês em Dublin</a> é útil porque você pode conhecer novas palavras enquanto você conversa ou apenas andando sem rumo e visitando lugares.

Por este motivo, Barry - meu professor - nos leva todas as quintas para um passeio cultural para mostrar aos alunos alguns museus e galerias em Dublin. Já tive oportunidade de visitar a galeria Hugh Lane, a igreja St Michan's e o Museu Nacional de Arqueologia e gostei da experiência de tocar em dedo de múmia, ver esqueletos e conhecer mais o trabalho de Francis Bacon.

Na semana passada, o passeio cultural voltou a ser realizado após alguns meses de hiato, mas não pude ir ao Museu Irlandês de Arte Contemporânea. O destino de amanhã é a Science Gallery na Trinity College.

Essa foi apenas uma sugestão para melhorar o seu inglês além de frequentar <a title="English Classes Dublin" href="http://www.ulearn.ie/quality_english_courses_dublin" target="_blank">Aulas de Inglês em Dublin</a>.

Até a próxima com mais experiências direto da Ilha Esmeralda.]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>69</wp:post_id>

		<wp:comment_status>open</wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status>open</wp:ping_status>
		<wp:post_name>passeios-culturais-da-minha-escola-de-ingles</wp:post_name>
		<wp:status>publish</wp:status>
		<wp:post_parent>0</wp:post_parent>
		<wp:menu_order>0</wp:menu_order>
		<wp:post_type>post</wp:post_type>
		<wp:post_password></wp:post_password>

		</wp:postmeta>

		<wp:meta_key>_edit_lock</wp:meta_key>

				<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key>jabber_published</wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[1297278190]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							</item>
		<item>
		<title>Cultural trips of my English Language School</title>
		<link>http://estudandoemdublin.wordpress.com/2011/02/09/cultural-trips-of-my-english-language-school/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 09 Feb 2011 19:06:34 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[estudandoemdublin]]></dc:creator>
		
		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[dublin]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="dublin"><![CDATA[dublin]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[english]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="english"><![CDATA[english]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[galleries]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="galleries"><![CDATA[galleries]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[ireland]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="ireland"><![CDATA[ireland]]></category>

		<category domain="tag"><![CDATA[museums]]></category>

		<category domain="tag" nicename="museums"><![CDATA[museums]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Uncategorized]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="uncategorized"><![CDATA[Uncategorized]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://estudandoemdublin.wordpress.com/?p=65</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<a href="http://estudandoemdublin.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/nationalmuseum.jpg"><img class="alignright size-medium wp-image-66" title="nationalmuseum" src="http://estudandoemdublin.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/nationalmuseum.jpg?w=300" alt="" width="300" height="167" /></a>

For those who still think that it's just attending classes to learn a language, make sure that every situation during our daily routine might help us get in touch with more vocabulary, grammar, listening and speaking. Having said that, to <a title="Learn English Dublin" href="http://www.ulearn.ie/learn_english_dublin" target="_blank">Learn English Dublin</a> is useful because some words might come up while you're talking to someone or just walking around and visiting places.

For this reason, on thursdays my teacher Barry takes us to a cultural trip in order to show some museums and galleries in Dublin. I already had the opportunity of visiting the Hugh Lane Gallery, St Michan's Church and the National Museum of Archaeology and I enjoyed the experience of touching a mummy's finger, looking at skulls and learning more about Francis Bacon.

Last week, the cultural trip returned after some months of hiatus but I wasn't able to go to the Irish Museum of Modern Art. Tomorrow's destination is the Science Gallery at Trinity College at 2pm.

This was a just one suggestion to improve your english apart from having <a title="English Classes Dublin" href="http://www.ulearn.ie/quality_english_courses_dublin" target="_blank">English Classes Dublin</a>.

See you next time with more experiences from the Emerald Isle.]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
